channel.title: 317 [PI] Help
channel.description: I am having difficulties with an issue that i know is dealing with the cache, but i am not sure how to fix it. I changed the background to my rsps on the vps in the cache files, compiled, did everything you are supposed to, then jarred it. The background change shows up on the vps, but not on other computers. This is why I know that the issue is cache-sided, because for some reason, the updated cache is not downloading to the other computers. I have even tried putting the updated cache on dropbox and putting the link to that in cachedownloader.java, but that didnt work either. At this point, idk what to do. Little help?

item.title: 317 [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @Planet_X Planet X
item.description:
@Planet_X wrote:

Oh my haha ;-;, yeah It’d help if you zipped all the files… xD

Read full topic

item.title: 317 [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

[quote=“Planet X, post:7, topic:549922”][quote author=beale link=topic=668801.msg4473204#msg4473204 date=1424295075]

Did you put the new cache upload into the new clients Cache Downloader?

yes, i did that, which is why i dont understand why it isnt doing it…

Again, a print of the error?

There is no error in the compilers or runserver.bat/run.bat, the thing is the background just doesnt change. I have re-uploaded cache to dropbox and put new link into cachedownloader.java, compiled, everything. That is what is bothering mee, it just wont change on other computers, like the updated cache wont load to other computers, it loads the old cache.
[/quote]

Ight man, here’s how we can solve this easily.
Go to google.com and download teamviewer if you don’t already have.
Open it then PM me on here ur ID and PW I’m glad to help, and show you what you’re doing wrong.[/quote]

Thanks man, but i figured it out. Simple mistake, honestly… RAR’ed the cache files instead of zipping them…

Read full topic

I have re-uploaded cache to dropbox and put new link into cachedownloader.java, compiled, everything. That is what is bothering mee, it just wont change on other computers, like the updated cache wont load to other computers, it loads the old cache.[/quote]

Ight man, here’s how we can solve this easily.
Go to google.com and download teamviewer if you don’t already have.
Open it then PM me on here ur ID and PW I’m glad to help, and show you what you’re doing wrong.

Read full topic
